messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Florida hs'ers
messages.msgSnippet: ... after you tell it to submit the order it should ask you for the address.  You can click the back button to go back and order other stuff too (such as if
messages.messageBody:
At 07:52 PM 2/4/01 -0500, you wrote:
>Sandi I tried to get some of the materials. I put stuff in my cart but it
>never asked me where to send it. Any ideas of what step I'm missing?


after you tell it to submit the order it should ask you for the
address. You can click the back button to go back and order other stuff
too (such as if you need multiple grades). Once you are all done, hit the
SUBMIT ORDER, it will take you to another page that looks almost the same
as the one you were on, scroll down and there should be a place to put in
your info (or at least there is when I do it).

I know the box that I had sent to my sisters weighed over 25 lbs!! She
said there was a lot of neat stuff in it too!

I hope that helped!

Sandi
--------------------------------------------------------------

Take no heroes,
Only inspiration.

Piston Ported Vespas:

messages.subject: Re: e-mail list
messages.msgSnippet: For anyone who doesn t want to have to mess with the website, you can handle your subscription entirely by email. To change your subscription to digest (25
messages.messageBody:
For anyone who doesn't want to have to mess with the website, you can handle
your subscription entirely by email.

To change your subscription to digest (25 messages per email instead of one
at a time) you can send an email to:

Unschooling-dotcom-digest@yahoogroups.com

You don't need anything in the subject or body of the email.

To return to individual emails send to:

Unschooling-dotcom-normal@yahoogroups.com

To temporarily stop receiving mail without leaving the group send email to:

Unschooling-dotcom-nomail@yahoogroups.com

To unsubscribe:

Unschooling-dotcom-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com

To come on back <g>

Unschooling-dotcom-subscribe@yahoogroups.com

messages.subject: Florida hs'ers
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hi all you Floridians!  I do not live in Florida, but my sister does (though she has not come over to the ways of homeschooling yet *sigh* but her child is
messages.messageBody:
At 07:15 PM 2/3/01 -0600, you wrote:

>Thank you Susan. I appreciate the info!! I see you HS in Florida...So do
>I. If you want, feel free to write me directly at my e-mail address.
>Hope to hear from you!! A. Shaffer


Hi all you Floridians! I do not live in Florida, but my sister does
(though she has not come over to the ways of homeschooling yet *sigh* but
her child is only 1, lol!)

Anyway, recently I sent for a bunch of stuff available only to Florida
educators (I had it sent to my sisters house, because I try to visit
often). I thought I would pass the link along in case any of you had not
come across it. There were even puppets (big ones my sister said). So, I
hope maybe some florida family finds this useful!

http://www.dairycouncil.org/edu.htm

Sandi
--------------------------------------------------------------
"What we want to see is the child in pursuit of knowledge, not knowledge in
pursuit of the child."
-- George Bernard Shaw

Hope to hear from you!! A. Shaffer

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] e-mail list
messages.msgSnippet: Go to yahooegroups.com & modify yours to be in digest form.  That way you ll get fewer individual messages & you ll get longer ones to wade through. Another
messages.messageBody: Go to yahooegroups.com & modify yours to be in digest form.  That way you'll get fewer individual messages & you'll get longer ones to wade through.  Another way to go is put no messages & just go on line & read the ones you want.

messages.subject: e-mail list
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Out there in computer land..... I am new to this message board, but do belong to a local homeschool message board in my hometown.  On our local board,  I
messages.messageBody:
Hi, Out there in computer land.....
I am new to this message board, but do belong to a local
homeschool message board in my hometown. On our local board, I
receive 1 main e-mail message with the list of everything that is
posted. Could someone PLEASE tell me how I can receive just one main
e-mail list from this site, instead of receiveing 66 or more in a
day? I do not have the time to click on each e-mail message, nor
read through all the "topics" that do not interest my family.
I would appreciate some help.....Thanks!
A. Shaffer
